sentence: Du kannst nur noch zwei Tage in der WG bleiben.
translation: You can only stay in the shared apartment for two more days.
analysis: Du [You, subject, nominative] kannst [can, verb, present tense] nur [only, adverb] noch [still, adverb] zwei [two, adjective] Tage [days, accusative, plural] in [in, preposition] der [the, definite article, dative, feminine] WG [shared apartment, noun, dative] bleiben [stay, verb, infinitive].
Dann [Then, adverb] musst [must, verb, present tense] du [you, subject, nominative] umziehen [move, verb, infinitive].
Verstehst [understand, verb, present tense] du [you, subject, nominative]?
Unsere [our, possessive pronoun, nominative, feminine] Heizung [heating, noun, nominative, feminine] ist [is, verb, present tense] kaputt [broken, adjective].

sentence: Sebastian, Nina, Nawin und ich fahren dann in Urlaub.
translation: Sebastian, Nina, Nawin, and I are going on vacation then.
analysis: Sebastian [Sebastian, proper noun], Nina [Nina, proper noun], Nawin [Nawin, proper noun] und [and, conjunction] ich [I, subject, nominative] fahren [are going, verb, present tense] dann [then, adverb] in [on, preposition] Urlaub [vacation, accusative].
Du [you, subject, nominative] bist [are, verb, present tense] nicht [not, adverb] da [there, adverb]?

Ich [I, subject, nominative] suche [will find, verb, present tense] mir [for myself, reflexive pronoun, dative] ein [a, indefinite article, accusative, neuter] Hotel [hotel, noun, accusative, neuter].
Das [That, subject, nominative, neuter] ist [is, verb, present tense] sehr [very, adverb] teuer [expensive, adjective].
Eine [A, indefinite article, nominative, feminine] Jugendherberge [youth hostel, noun, nominative, feminine] ist [is, verb, present tense] besser [better, adjective].

sentence: Jugendherbergen und Hostels sind nicht so teuer wie ein Hotel.
translation: Youth hostels and hostels are not as expensive as a hotel.
analysis: Jugendherbergen [Youth hostels, noun, nominative, plural] und [and, conjunction] Hostels [hostels, noun, nominative, plural] sind [are, verb, present tense] nicht [not, adverb] so [as, adverb] teuer [expensive, adjective] wie [as, conjunction] ein [a, indefinite article, nominative, neuter] Hotel [hotel, noun, nominative, neuter].
Viele [many, adjective] junge [young, adjective] Leute [people, noun, nominative, plural] übernachten [stay, verb, present tense] dort [there, adverb].

sentence: Und ich frag meine Freunde und Bekannten.
translation: And I will ask my friends and acquaintances.
analysis: Und [and, conjunction] ich [I, subject, nominative] frag [will ask, verb, present tense, colloquial form of 'frage'] meine [my, possessive pronoun, accusative, plural] Freunde [friends, noun, accusative, plural] und [and, conjunction] Bekannten [acquaintances, noun, accusative, plural].

sentence: Vielleicht haben sie ein Zimmer frei.
translation: Maybe they have a room available.
analysis: Vielleicht [maybe, adverb] haben [have, verb, present tense] sie [they, subject, nominative] ein [a, indefinite article, accusative, neuter] Zimmer [room, noun, accusative, neuter] frei [available, adjective].
